page.title: 15Wildlife around Cattistock
page.content: Because of the great variety of habitat a wide range of animals live in and around Cattistock. The hedgerows in the area contain most of the British species of small mammals: stoats, weasels, rabbits and a large number of hedgehogs, besides countless rodents of all kinds. Both grass and smooth snakes are often seen. There are four known badger setts in the woodlands, as well as many foxes, grey squirrels and several roe deer. The River Frome, which contains trout and several other species of fish, supports coot, moorhen and visiting herons. A colony of swifts returns to the village each summer, along with large numbers of swallows and house martins. There are several rookeries and buzzards nesting every year, also three types of owl.
